meanings.definition: The quality or state of being very cold in temperature.
meanings.sent1: The frigidness of the ice made it difficult to walk on.
meanings.sent2: The frigidness of the winter air chilled us to the bone.
meanings.sent3: Despite the frigidness outside, the kids still wanted to play in the snow.
meanings.sent4: The frigidness of the freezer was like stepping into a polar bear's den.
meanings.sent5: The frigidness of the lake was so intense that it seemed to freeze time itself.

meanings.definition: Lack of warmth or enthusiasm in behavior or attitude.
meanings.sent1: Her frigidness towards the idea made it clear she was not interested.
meanings.sent2: The frigidness in his voice indicated he was upset.
meanings.sent3: Despite his frigidness, she tried to cheer him up with a joke.
meanings.sent4: The frigidness in the room was palpable, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: Her frigidness towards the project dampened the team's spirits.
